messages.content: ComfyUI ReSharpen is an extension for ComfyUI that allows you to increase or decrease the amount of details generated during the Stable Diffusion pipeline.
Is ComfyUI ReSharpen just a postprocessing filter?
No, ComfyUI ReSharpen is not just a postprocessing filter. It adjusts the amount of details generated during the Stable Diffusion pipeline.
How do you adjust the level of detail using ComfyUI ReSharpen?

To adjust the level of detail, attach the ReSharpen node between the Empty Latent and your Sampler node of choice, then adjust the details slider. Positive values make the image noisy while negative values make it blurry.
What happens if the details value is set too high or too low in ComfyUI ReSharpen?
If the details value is set too high or too low in ComfyUI ReSharpen, the result may become distorted.
Do ancestral samplers work with ComfyUI ReSharpen?
No, ancestral samplers such as Euler a do not work with ComfyUI ReSharpen.
How can you disable the effect of ReSharpen during other parts of the workflow in ComfyUI?
To disable the effect of ReSharpen during other parts of the workflow, you need to add another ReSharpen node and set the details to 0.
Where can you find more information on how ComfyUI ReSharpen works?
You can find more information on how ComfyUI ReSharpen works by following the 'How does it work?' link in the documentation.
